SEARCH
Package org.jarzarr.scene

Interface Scene

All Known Implementing Classes:
TransitionScene, UIScene
public interface Scene
Core scene interface.

A Scene represents a self-contained state of the application (gameplay, menu, pause screen, dialog, etc.). The engine delegates update and render calls to the active scene(s) through the SceneManager.

Scenes are lifecycle-managed:

  • onEnter() is called when the scene becomes active
  • onExit() is called when the scene is removed

Scenes may optionally act as overlays (menus, pause screens) that render on top of scenes below them.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default boolean
    isOverlay()
    Indicates whether this scene is an overlay.
    void

    Called once when the scene becomes active.

  • Method Details

    • onEnter

      void onEnter()
      Called once when the scene becomes active. Use this to allocate resources, reset state, or register listeners.

    • onExit

      void onExit()
      Called once when the scene is removed or replaced. Use this to clean up resources or unregister listeners.

    • update

      void update(double dt)
      Fixed-timestep update logic. Called from the engine's update loop.
      Parameters:
      dt - fixed delta time in seconds

    • render

      void render(Graphics2D g)
      Render hook called once per frame. All drawing should be performed using the provided Graphics2D.
      Parameters:
      g - graphics context for the current frame

    • onResize

      default void onResize(int width, int height)
      Optional window resize callback. Called whenever the window's canvas size changes.
      Parameters:
      width - new canvas width
      height - new canvas height

    • isOverlay

      default boolean isOverlay()
      Indicates whether this scene is an overlay.

      If true, scenes below this one in the stack will also render. Common examples include pause menus, HUDs, and dialogs.

      If false, this scene is treated as a base scene and will obscure scenes below it.

      Returns:
      true if this scene should render on top of lower scenes
